We use telescopes to see far away objects that are too small or too far to see with our eyes. We also use computers to calculate where the planets are and where they will be in the future. Scientists who study astronomy try to figure out how the universe began and how it is changing. They also try to learn about the life forms that might exist on other planets. It's a fascinating field of study that helps us understand our place in the universe.

Step 1: Think about how to explain 'astronomy' to someone reading at the Upper Elementary level.
Step 2: Select appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure.
Step 3: Write a paragraph of 100 words that follows your plan. I chose to start with the definition of astronomy and then provide examples of what astronomers do.
Astronomy is the study of the universe and the objects in it. Astronomers are scientists who look up at the stars and planets and try to learn more about them. They use special tools like telescopes and computers to study the sun, moon, stars, and planets. For example, astronomers study the paths of comets and asteroids to predict when they will come close to Earth. They also study the universe's biggest mysteries, like black holes and dark matter. Astronomers help us learn more about the world beyond our planet.
